docs.snippet: The report of the Grinding Committee came up. Mr. DARCI moved to recommit the bill to prohibit  the use of suspension bridges at ferry landings, with instructions to striks out the word "pier" wherever it appears.
docs.lead_paragraph: The report of the Grinding Committee came up. Mr. DARCI moved to recommit the bill to prohibit the use of suspension bridges at ferry landings, with instructions to striks out the word "pier" wherever it appears.

docs.snippet: In the Senate, yesterday, a favorable report was made on the bill to amend the law relative to taking the testimony of witnesses out of the State; also on the bill to authorize clerks of Boards of  Excise to take affidavits in certain cases. A bill...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate, yesterday, a favorable report was made on the bill to amend the law relative to taking the testimony of witnesses out of the State; also on the bill to authorize clerks of Boards of Excise to take affidavits in certain cases. A bill to encourage investments of small sums in the stocks of the State was introduced.

headline.main: MANHATTAN LAKE.; A Few Words about the Grand Receiving Reservoir.

docs.abstract: New receiving reservoir described; to be named Manhattan Lake
docs.lead_paragraph: If there are any among us possessing a shade of the universally recognized American peculiarity curiosity or takes an interest in the various improvements in progress in and about the City, and has not yet visited the new Receiving Reservoir in Central Park, they should make the pilgrimage without delay.

docs.snippet: A recent letter from Egypt to a Boston cotemporary gives an interesting account of an interview had by the writer with Mr. BUCKLE, the distinguished author of the History of Civilization in England, who is now temporarily sojourning for health in the...

headline.main: Mr. Buckle's Visit to the United States.

docs.lead_paragraph: A recent letter from Egypt to a Boston cotemporary gives an interesting account of an interview had by the writer with Mr. BUCKLE, the distinguished author of the History of Civilization in England, who is now temporarily sojourning for health in the mystic land of the Pyramids. From this source we learn that it is the intention of Mr. BUCKLE soon to pay a visit to the United States.

docs.snippet: The Senate had quite a long and animated discussion, last evening, over a bill purporting to amend the General Railroad Act.

headline.main: NEWS FROM ALBANY.; The Proposed Amendment of the General Railroad Law--The Death of the Bill in the Senate--Discussion of the Assessment Bill in the Senate--Animated Debate on the Health Bill--Enlarging the Champlain Canal, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate had quite a long and animated discussion, last evening, over a bill purporting to amend the General Railroad Act.

docs.snippet: In the Senate, yesterday, among the bills reported favorably, was one to amend the General Manufacturing law, and the one to correct abuses  in relaying pavements in this City.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate, yesterday, among the bills reported favorably, was one to amend the General Manufacturing law, and the one to correct abuses in relaying pavements in this City.

docs.snippet: Among the suddenly descending bolts which have within a few days past fallen so thickly among the ranks of professional men in this City, riving away ornaments of the bar, genial members of society, heads of families, and cherished friends, none has...

headline.main: Obituary.; DEATH OF PETER E. WOODBURY, ESQ. BISHOP MEADE, OF VIRGINIA

docs.abstract: Meade, (Rt. Rev) William; Episcopal Bishop of Virginia; Woodbury, Peter T; NYC lawyer
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the suddenly descending bolts which have within a few days past fallen so thickly among the ranks of professional men in this City, riving away ornaments of the bar, genial members of society, heads of families, and cherished friends, none has sped to its fatal work more swiftly, or left more disastrous results in its path, than that which has just fallen on Mr. WOODBURY.

headline.main: PROCEEDINGS OF THE LEGISLATURE.; SENATE. ASSEMBLY.

docs.snippet: THS LEGAL-TENDER NOTES NEARLY READY. The new legal-tender notes, authorized under the  recent act of Congress, are expected soon to be ready for delivery to the Treasury Department, and will be paid out early during next month.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; The New Legal Tender Notes Nearby Ready for Use. Arrangements for Trade in the Southwest. Important Modifications of the Tax Bill. The Construction of the Stevens Battery Authorized by the Senate. Thirteen Millions for Armored Vessels. A Line of Fast Steamers Between Washington and Fortress Monroe.OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES SECRETARY SEWARD AT HARPER'S FERRY. CARS RUNNING TO MANASSAS. GEN. CADWALLADER TO TAKE THE FIELD. PARDONED BY THE PESIDENT. A BALTIMORE LAWYER KILLED. THE TAX UPON ADVERTISEMENTS, ETC. CONTRABANDS. GONE TO FORTRESS MONROE. TRADE TO FOLLOW THE FLAG. SHIPPINGE POINT, EVANSPORT, AQUIA CREEK, ETC., MAIL SERVICE. COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE WITH REBEL STATES. TEXAS RANGERS CAPTURED. COL. MAGOFFIN TO BE SHOT. A LINE OF STEAMERS TO FORTRESS MONROE. A New-York Company are making arrangements to establish a line of steamers between Washington and Fortress Monroe, and to place on the route two of the fastest and best North River boats, which will make the passage in nine hour. docs.lead_paragraph: THS LEGAL-TENDER NOTES NEARLY READY. The new legal-tender notes, authorized under the recent act of Congress, are expected soon to be ready for delivery to the Treasury Department, and will be paid out early during next month.

headline.main: THE WAR IN MEXICO; Documentary History of the Expedition. Negotiations Between the Foreign Offices of England, France and Spain. THE ORIGIN AND AIM OF THE ENTER-PRISE.
